newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico same-day Cetes rate closes higher at 24 pct.
newsitem.headline: Mexico same-day Cetes rate closes higher at 24 pct.

text.p: Mexico's same-day Cetes rate closed higher on Thursday, reversing a downward trend when one investor brought paper into the secondary money market MXAAB at the end of the day in order to square positions, dealers said.
The same-day Cetes rate rose 50 basis points to 24 percent, a rate dealers said was not representative of the market. Earlier Thursday, the rate bottomed out at 23 percent.
"Rates were way down because of speculation," one dealer said. "People didn't want to buy paper at those levels, and then someone came in with a lot of paper and in order to square positions."
Rates for bank notes and acceptances dropped 90 basis points to close at 24.50.

Rates on longer-term Cetes also fell sharply in the secondary market with 28-day Cetes down 57 basis points to 24 percent, 91-day rates down 125 basis points to 26.50 percent and six-month rates down 160 basis points to 29 percent.

Dealers said expectations for another round of rate drops in next week's primary Cetes auction and a heavy liquidity injection of 14.196 billion pesos by Banco de Mexico on Thursday helped bring rates down.
The shortfall for Friday is estimated at four billion pesos.
